intro: Ilex tetramera var. tetramera, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often used in horticulture for its evergreen foliage and seasonal fruit display. The species is also noted for its ecological importance, providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
